title: Amazon Settles Case With Two Employees Who Said They Were Wrongly Fired
sub_head: Agreement resolves complaint filed by local Washington state union last year
body:
Amazon.com Inc. has settled a case brought against the tech giant by a workers’ union alleging it wrongly fired two employees.
The complaint, filed with the National Labor Relations Board about a year ago, said Amazon violated the National Labor Relations Act and fired the two employees for “their support for fellow Amazon employees’ working conditions.” Amazon said the employees were fired for repeatedly violating internal policies.
